conclusion: Patriarchy is a totalitarian belief system grounded in male supremacy that requires constant propaganda and violence to maintain
Male power manifests through seven key mechanisms: metaphysical assertion of self, physical strength, capacity to terrorize, power of naming, power of owning, power of money, and power of sex
The male self is defined by a continuum of wanting and taking, expressed as "I want and I am entitled to have, therefore I am"
Men occupy a powerful subject position protected by laws, customs, art, literature, and history
Sexism is the foundation on which all tyranny is built, and every social form of hierarchy and abuse is modeled on male-over-female domination
Under patriarchy, every woman is a victim—past, present, and future
Under patriarchy, every woman's son is her potential betrayer and also the inevitable rapist or exploiter of another woman
Under patriarchy, no woman is safe to live her life, to love, or to mother children
All personal, psychological, social, and institutionalized domination can be traced back to the phallic identities of men
Men are distinguished from women by their commitment to do violence rather than to be victimized by it
Patriarchy is not natural, having only been around for about two percent of human history
The cultural institutions that embody male supremacy—law, art, religion, nation-states, the family—must be destroyed
We live in a homosexual society because all credible transactions of power, authority, and authenticity take place among men
Men are real; therefore, all real relationships, communications, reciprocity, and mutuality occur between men
The common erotic project of destroying women makes it possible for men to unite into a brotherhood
Male bonding is based on the shared project of destroying and exploiting women
Pornography is the essential sexuality of male power: of hate, of ownership, of hierarchy, of sadism, of dominance

Pornography is a celebration of rape and injury to women

The new pornography is a vast graveyard where the left has gone to die
The left cannot have its whores and its politics, too
Pornography defines women in terms of sexual colonization and says that women's bodies belong to men
Pornography is the graphic depiction of whores
Erotica is simply high-class pornography: better produced, designed for a better class of consumer
Women do not believe that men believe what pornography says about women, but men do believe it
Pornography happens to women—it happens in real life, to real women
In pornography, women's lives are made two-dimensional and dead; women are flattened on the page or screen
Dehumanization through pornography is real—women are turned into objects, specifically into targets
The pornographic object is unique because it has a will that says "hurt me"
Pornography sexualizes insult, humiliation, and cruelty
Any violation of a woman's body can become sex for men; this is the essential truth of pornography
When your rape is entertainment, your worthlessness is absolute
Violence against prostitutes, regardless of its ferocity, is accepted as a fact of life
Feminists are often asked whether pornography causes rape, but the fact is that rape and prostitution cause pornography
Sexual intercourse in a patriarchal society constitutes a central part of women's subordination to men
Intercourse is the pure, sterile, formal expression of men's contempt for women
Sexual intercourse always takes place within a social context of male dominance
The meaning of intercourse is independent of what individual acts might mean to the participants
Even feminist men dominate and control women when they have intercourse with them
Even women who experience coital pleasure are violated and dominated due to social power relations
Social power relations determine the negative meaning of intercourse, not individual intentions or feelings
Intercourse occurs in a context of power relations that is pervasive and incontrovertible
Most men have controlling power over what they call "their women"—the women they fuck
The social power of men is enacted in and reinforced through coitus
Intercourse experienced under force, fear, and inequality destroys in women the will to political freedom

The end of male dominance would mean the end of sex as currently constructed
Fucking can be a communion, a sharing, mutual possession of an enormous mystery, with the intensity and magnificence of violent feeling transformed into tenderness

Removing these protections without making more fundamental changes only further disempowers women
Right-wing women recognize that the liberation offered by the Left is no liberation at all

Faced with the choice between continuing the fight for freedom and shifting allegiance back to male supremacy, male radicals chose the latter
Feminism is the simplest revolutionary idea ever conceived, and also the most despised
Feminism requires precisely what patriarchy destroys in women: unimpeachable bravery in confronting male power
